common_issues.title: Pieces OS High CPU Usage
common_issues.description: Users report high CPU usage and slow performance in Pieces OS, particularly with Long Term Memory enabled. Issues are linked to WebView2 and Microsoft Edge interaction. Workarounds include updating software, restarting LTM2, and specific file system configurations. The Pieces team is actively investigating and releasing patches.

related_issues.title: Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
related_issues.text:
Long Term Memory still slows down my PC, even after updating to LTM-2
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Turning on Long Term Memory has been slowing down my desktop computer, even before LTM-2. After updating today, it still happens. It's most noticeable when I use Slack and Discord, and disabling those apps on LTM doesn't work. Even after switching the Processing Mode to Cloud, as suggested by HRA42 on the Discord server, the lag still occurs. At some point, the total CPU usage went up by over 90%.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eaef0d65-b19b-41f0-bf8a-f143fa8d1e43)

My computer specs:
- CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-6300 CPU @ 3.80GHz
- RAM: DDR4 32 GB
- Graphics: GeForce GTX 950 2 GB

I'm yet to notice significant slowness on other programs, but if I'm getting a lot of lag on those chat apps, I can imagine I would get them too on something heavier like Visual Studio.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: High CPU Usage in PiecesOS

**Key points raised:**

* High CPU usage in PiecesOS, particularly on Discord and with LTM2 enabled.
* Users report spikes up to 100% CPU usage.
* Affected users are on Windows 10 and 11 with varying hardware configurations.
* Issue appears related to WebView2 usage and interaction with Microsoft Edge.

**Problems identified:**

* High CPU usage leads to sluggish performance and an overall poor user experience.
* Specific issues noted include slow scrolling and window movement in Microsoft Edge.
* VSCode plugin may contribute to temporary CPU spikes during data snapshotting.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team released multiple hotfixes and patches to address the issue.
* Some users reported improvement with Microsoft Edge and WebView2 updates.
* Moving com.pieces.os/com.pieces.pfd folders to a ReFS volume and creating symbolic links was suggested as a potential solution.
* Restarting LTM2 may temporarily alleviate the issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue appears to be ongoing for some users, with spikes still occurring despite updates and workarounds.
* Pieces team is actively investigating the root cause and working on a permanent fix.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation spans multiple days with various users providing updates and feedback.
* Screenshots are used to illustrate the CPU usage and performance impact.

related_issues.title: Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @bpluly encountered several issues with the Pieces app, leading to a poor first experience and uninstallation.
* Issues included slow performance, launch issues, and boot-up delays.

**Problems Identified:**

* Long Term Memory feature caused performance issues.
* PiecesOS launch and boot-up processes faced problems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user was directed to relevant support resources and similar issues.
* The Pieces support team member offered a call to discuss the issues and troubleshoot.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User uninstalled the app due to negative experience.
* Support team aims to understand the issues and potentially resolve them with the user's help.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation occurred in March 2025.
* The user was not available for further follow-up after the initial support contact.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

### Key Points Raised:
* Ollama installation failing with error message "Ollama failed to install" in Pieces-OS.
* This issue prevents both downloading and inference of local LLM models.
* The underlying problem is the missing `curl` program in the sandboxed environment of Pieces-OS.

### Problems Identified:
* Missing `curl` program in Pieces-OS snap prevents download and installation of Ollama.
* Ollama installation failure due to missing `curl`.
* Downloaded Ollama not accessible within Pieces-OS sandbox.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:
* Patching the package to avoid using `curl`.
* Modifying snap definition to include `curl` as a dependency.
* Allowing Ollama installation and access within the sandbox environment.

### Current Status/Outcome:
* Solution still under development, expected in the upcoming week.
* Manual download of LLM models not possible due to the broader impact of the issue.
* Users await the fix to enable local LLM model functionality.

### Additional Notes:
* The issue was initially identified in December 2024 and is still ongoing. 
* Users are requesting a faster resolution as they require local LLM functionality.
* The development team is aware of the urgency and working towards a solution.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User MoyinShabi is having trouble connecting Pieces for Developers to Pieces OS.
* The issue started after a significant update was pushed on March 3rd.
* MoyinShabi did not receive any health check notifications on their desktop.

**Problems identified:**

* Issues with the user's desktop app's database.
* An error with the GetIt flutter package not finding a particular dependency.
* The inability to reproduce the issue on the developer's end.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Sharing log files and folders for analysis.
* Downloading and replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder with a repaired version.
* Scheduling a video call for further troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue persists even after replacing the "com.pieces.pfd" folder.
* A live troubleshooting session is scheduled for further diagnosis.

**Additional notes:**

* The support team was quick to respond and try to resolve the issue.
* The user was actively engaged in providing information and collaborating to find a solution.

Please note that this summary focuses on the most important details of the conversation. More specific details can be found in the original conversation on GitHub.

related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Problem:** 
- Copilot not responding properly to user queries after 11 requests and responses.
- No files loaded into the context.

**Key Points Raised:**
- User unable to narrow down the issue for reproduction.
- Issue does not appear with Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
- Switching to Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
- Issue resolved after switching to Gemini 2.0 Flash LLM.
- Ticket closed pending next update 11.2.3.

**Additional Notes:**
- User encouraged to reach back out if the issue persists after the update.

* Users who are experiencing this problem should continue to use the restart workaround.

**Additional notes:**

* Users are encouraged to share additional information about their specific setups and the issues they are experiencing.

related_issues.text:
Pieces OS unable to enable LTM
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When attempting to enable the LTM engine, either in the Pieces desktop app by clicking "Allow" for "Periodic Application Indexing" or in the Pieces OS directly, clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine", nothing happens. Even after multiple Pieces OS restarts and a clean install. 

Tailed the local log while doing both operations, only clicking "Enable Long Term Memory Engine" resulted in logs:
```
[D]  Sentry Error Event: 351d4b13dbae46589cabd593569f9049
```

[piecesOS-03162025log.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19275571/piecesOS-03162025log.txt)
Also confirmed permissions were granted appropriately:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2fa7002e-0c18-46fe-abaf-288350a90b1b)

Loop in Detail:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c964a15d-2307-4d83-a9f8-0d82d7b608b8

I can reproduce quickly and easily if you need more details/fresh logs!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Pieces user kwburgess is experiencing problems activating the Long Term Memory engine (LTM).

**Key points raised:**

* User is encountering permission issues.
* User is unable to activate LTM.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS requires specific permissions (Screen & System recording and Accessibility) to function properly.
* User's local machine might not have granted these permissions.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Support representative requests confirmation of permission grants.
* Representative offers to resolve the issue in real-time via a scheduled meeting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user hasn't responded yet. 
* The issue remains open and awaiting user input.

**Additional information:**

* The support representative provided helpful resources related to similar issues and Pieces documentation. 
* The conversation indicates a prompt and supportive response from the Pieces team.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

* Laborer123 is having trouble changing their personal domain after copying com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd to another PC.
* Laborer123 is also having trouble restoring a backup from a long time ago.

* The backup that Laborer123 wants to restore is from a long time ago.

related_issues.text:
Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @bpluly encountered several issues with the Pieces app, leading to a poor first experience and uninstallation.
* Issues included slow performance, launch issues, and boot-up delays.

**Problems Identified:**

* Long Term Memory feature caused performance issues.
* PiecesOS launch and boot-up processes faced problems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user was directed to relevant support resources and similar issues.
* The Pieces support team member offered a call to discuss the issues and troubleshoot.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User uninstalled the app due to negative experience.
* Support team aims to understand the issues and potentially resolve them with the user's help.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation occurred in March 2025.
* The user was not available for further follow-up after the initial support contact.

recommendations: **Prioritize 'Pieces OS High CPU Usage' and 'Pieces Desktop Fails to Launch':** These are the most common and potentially impactful issues reported by users. Allocate resources to investigate and address the root causes swiftly.
**Improve Copilot Responsiveness:** Investigate and address the issue of Copilot providing vague responses or failing to respond. This impacts user experience and productivity.

**Enhance PiecesOS Functionality and Performance:** Address the reported issues with Long Term Memory, unexpected application behavior, and performance degradation to ensure a seamless user experience.
**Strengthen Pieces Desktop and OS Integration:** Focus on resolving launch failures, performance bottlenecks, and backup/restore errors to ensure smooth interaction between Pieces Desktop and OS.
**Proactive Communication:**  Keep users informed about the status of known issues, particularly those with high activity levels, and provide clear workarounds or temporary solutions.
**Review and Update Support Documentation:** Ensure troubleshooting guides and FAQs cover the common issues and their solutions. This empowers users to resolve problems independently.

**Gather Detailed System Information:**  During support interactions, request users to provide detailed system information, log files, and steps to reproduce the issue. This aids in faster diagnosis and resolution.
**Analyze Ticket Trends:** Regularly analyze support ticket data to identify recurring issues, patterns, and areas for improvement in the software or support processes.
